entry.title: A Picture of Two Rabbits
entry.content:
India: This is a picture of two rabbits. This guy doesn’t really like this guy because… and this guy doesn’t really like this guy because he’s kind of mean, and really naughty. But these are rabbits… they live together but they don’t really like each other. It’s kind of like Ren and Stimpy, they’re very fond of each other but they get mad at each other. They give each other spankings —

समाधिBot: They do?

India: Yeah if they do something wrong, like to the meals, or what they’re going to sit on, or to the furniture…

समाधिBot: I can think of a couple other people like that.

India: Mmm-hmm…

समाधिBot: How come they have four arms and two legs each?

India: ‘Cos Taji really wanted four arms, because he wanted them to have twice the smack in their arms.

entry.title: A List of Things I Haven’t Found
entry.content:
India: This is a list of things I haven’t found, so whoever finds each or one of these things gets a prize. If you find this you get ice-cream. If you find my cheetah you get a unicorn —

समाधिBot: A real unicorn?

India: Yeah. Just a toy unicorn, but… for this one you get to play any game whenever you want, unless you’re too bored of the same games.

entry.title: A Bird Out in the Sunset
entry.content:
India: This is a picture of a bird out in the sunset. I made the sunset with light blue with block crayon, and purple with a kind of violety color for the violet. And I used this green with oil pastel and the rest with crayon, except for these flowers: these flowers I used with oil pastel. And the grass was with crayon and the branch was with crayon.

समाधिBot: What kind of bird is that?

India: Well… it’s kind of like a bird of paradise. The back is me and it goes for you.

समाधिBot: Oh that one’s mine?

India: Yeah.

समाधिBot: Thank you!

India: Anyway, let’s move on to the next one…

entry.title: Valen’s Day Card
entry.content:
India: This is mommy’s Valen’s Day card that I worked on very hard, but a couple problems lingered around, like somebody tripping me, or tipping the table or wobbling my chair. But it turned out beautiful!

समाधिBot: It sure did.

India: Yeah. There was this color that looked like a brown but it turned out this color. This is crayon, but this I used oil pastel with it.

समाधिBot: They call that “mixed media.”

India: Yeah. I had to used a dark red and a little bit of dark purple to make this color.

समाधिBot: Is it any specific kind of butterfly?

India: Yes… it’s a kind of swallowtail butterfly. I’ve been working on it for weeks.

India: And this is the back…

समाधिBot: Tell me about the back.

India: The back was kind of made by crayon… a little bit of oil pastel, and some nice writing. This is only so she knows that it’s from me. And I drew this flower on the back, and this cat.

समाधिBot: Very nice. And a sun.

India: Yeah… a sun too. I kinda forgot to draw the grass but… it doesn’t really matter.

समाधिBot: Yeah I like it the way it is.

India: Let’s move on to the next one…

entry.title: The Rather Exciting Part
entry.content:
India: This one is the rather exciting part! This… is a really special… well I just choose pictures of the right kind of thing, and I chose this one as my favorite one —

Taj: It rather has a fat tauntaun.

India: It’s not a tauntaun, that’s just how it looks like… And these spiky things are called the tail spikes, annnnd —

Taj: And they shoot out poisonous… things?

India: Uchhhh, Taji it was a surprise! This is the awesome one…

Well anyway, it shoots these, they’re poisonous, and whoever touches it — they’re exploding. And if it sticks into them for too long they go like this [makes explosion sound] — explode. Anyway, the fire’s so hot, and whenever they lick people, their saliva is a big blueish purple laser. It drools on them, so whenever they lick something, this happens: [makes squelching sounds].

But this thing is like a big large crest. It uses this for display and head bumping with combat with the other dragons or weird looking hamsters, or… But this thing, or this thing, or this thing, or this thing means it’s a male or a female. This one is a male, because the males always have a diamond above the cobra shapes.

समाधिBot: Mmmm…

India: Annnd, they always, always, always have the weird looking doodad that points up there.

समाधिBot: Is that not over its eye?

Zahra: You want chochie [chocolate] guys?

समाधिBot: [Gasps] Yeah!!!

entry.title: Polluted Woodpecker
entry.content:
India: This is just full of birds. This is an ostrich… this is this kind of bird that lived back in time called the terror bird. This is…

समाधिBot: Terra bird or terror?

India: Terror, yes right.

समाधिBot: Like extremely frightening?

Taj: Did you know that terror birds actually eat baby saber tooth cats?

India: Yeah. This is a cassowary. That’s just a… a polluted woodpecker.

Taj: This is a kingfisher? Is this a kingfisher?

India: No! This is red bellied woodpecker. That’s a gold finch… black-capped chickadee… this is called the red faced woodpecker.

समाधिBot: Red faced woodpecker?

India: Yeah because they have red faces ‘cos they’re weird thieves… something. And this guy up here, I forget what it’s called but it is a cute little guy. But this is something that lives in…

Taj: Maybe you named it a cardinal.

India: Of course it’s not a cardinal! This is one that lives in India in a really weird part of it… This is kind of like the king of woodpeckers because it has this cool golden crest on its head.
